com.tomzhu.list

Class ArrayList<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomzhu.list.ArrayList<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of list element

    public class ArrayList<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple list implementation based on array. like ArrayList, this class would holds elements in an object array, and would automatically extends its memory when the added element exceeds threshold with a factor of 2.
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    tomzhu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayList()
      construct a array list with default capacity 10.
      ArrayList(int initCapa)
      construct a array list with initial capacity

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      clear this list
      E get(int i)
      try to get the element at location i and throws MyNosuchElementException when the location is not feasible such as negative or exceeds the current size of the list.
      int getSize() 
      void insert(E ele, int i)
      insert an element to specific location i.
      boolean isEmpty() 
      E remove(int i)
      try to remove and return the element at location i, throw MyNosuchElementException when the location i is not feasible.
      void replace(int i, E ele)
      try to replace the element at location i with new element ele.
      int search(E ele)
      search for the specific element, return the location if found or -1 cannot find.

      • ArrayList

        public ArrayList(int initCapa)
        construct a array list with initial capacity
        Parameters:
        initCapa - initial capacity

      • ArrayList

        public ArrayList()
        construct a array list with default capacity 10.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public E get(int i)
      throws MyNosuchElementException
        try to get the element at location i and throws MyNosuchElementException when the location is not feasible such as negative or exceeds the current size of the list. if i== 0, then return the head element and if i == this.getSize() - 1, then return the tail element.
        Parameters:
        i -
        Returns:
        the element at location i.
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • insert

        public void insert(E ele,
                   int i)
            throws MyNotSupportException
        insert an element to specific location i. throw @MyNotSupportException when the location i is beyond the current list size. if i == 0, would insert an element to the tail of this list and if i == this.getSize(), would just add this element to the tail.
        Parameters:
        ele - the element to insert
        i - the location
        Throws:
        MyNotSupportException

      • replace

        public void replace(int i,
                    E ele)
             throws MyNosuchElementException
        try to replace the element at location i with new element ele. throws MyNosuchElementException when the location i is not feasible.
        Parameters:
        i -
        ele -
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • remove

        public E remove(int i)
         throws MyNosuchElementException
        try to remove and return the element at location i, throw MyNosuchElementException when the location i is not feasible. if i == 0, remove the head element and if i == this.getSize() - 1, remove the tail element.
        Parameters:
        i - the location
        Returns:
        the element
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        whether this list is empty.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the size of this list

      • search

        public int search(E ele)
        search for the specific element, return the location if found or -1 cannot find.
        Parameters:
        ele -
        Returns:
        the location when found, -1 otherwise.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        clear this list
